snippet: Yang Maodong was detained by the police in early August on allegations of “assembling a crowd to disrupt order in a public place.”
abstract: Yang Maodong, prominent human rights campaigner in southern China, wins his first meeting with a lawyer after more than three months in detention; says he has been on a hunger strike.
lead_paragraph: Yang Maodong was detained by the police in early August on allegations of “assembling a crowd to disrupt order in a public place.”

headline.main: Chinese Rights Campaigner Held Hunger Strike, Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: China: Detainee Tells of Hunger Strike
